Adding a cushioned insole: A cushioned insole can provide additional comfort and support for the feet, especially for those who spend long hours standing or walking.
Incorporating smart technology: Adding sensors or a smartphone app can provide real-time feedback on the wearer's gait, posture, and overall foot health.
Upgrading the lacing system: Replacing traditional laces with a more secure and convenient option like a pull tab or a magnetic closure can make it easier to put on and take off the shoes.
Introducing a customizable design: Offering a range of colors, patterns, and materials can allow customers to personalize their shoes to their individual style and preferences.
Enhancing the sole: Upgrading the sole with a more ergonomic or shock-absorbing design can improve the overall comfort and performance of the shoes.
